content: b 15sc 1rdc 21sc 3dc 1sc 1sc 4dc *1sc 1dc repeat from * 3 times 2dc 1sc row 31 in colour a 15dc 1sc 21dc 3sc 1dc row 13 in colour a 3dc 12sc 11dc 1sc 1dc 4sc *1dc 1sc repeat from * 3 times 2sc 1dc row 14 in colour b 6sc 10rdc 10sc 1dc 1sc 4dc *1sc 1dc repeat from * 3 times 2dc 1sc row 15 in colour a 6dc 11sc 4dc 1sc 4dc 1sc 1dc 4sc *1dc 1sc repeat from * 3 times 2sc 1dc i zzy and frog horse bookend motif page 4/10 chart 2 - horse facing right right handed key single_crochet blo single_crochet in back loop only worked into stitch of the opposite colour in row below x x double_crochet flo double_crochet in front loop only worked into stitch of the same colour two row below right-angled double_crochet in front loop only \ \ rdc flo worked into stitch of the same colour to the right two row below left-angled double_crochet in front loop only / / ldc flo worked into stitch of the same colour to the left two row below double_crochet 2 together in front loop only rdc-double_crochet-2tog x\ the right side is a rdc worked into the stitch of the same colour to the right two row below flo the left side is a double_crochet worked into the stitch of the same colour two row below 0 chain chain row 0 is only necessary if this chart makes up part of your bottom shelf notes - column 41 should only be worked if this chart is the last leftmost chart on your shelf - the unnumbered columns marked a and b are a guide to show which colour should be used for that row and should not be worked - stitches in the opposite colour to the row will be always be single_crochet blo for this reason it is not necessary to pay attention to the colour of a given stitch when reading the chart only the symbol matters - sometimes more than one stitch will be worked into the same front loop such as when a rdc follows a double_crochet or a double_crochet follows a ldc some front loops will be skipped entirely such as when a ldc follows a double_crochet izzy and frog horse bookend motif page 5/10 written pattern for chart 2 horse facing right right handed notes - column 41 should only be worked if this is the last leftmost pattern on your shelf instructions for column 41 will be included in square brackets and italics - all single_crochet should be in back loop only - all double_crochet including ldc and rdc should be in front loop only - all odd numbered row will be worked in colour a - all even numbered row will be worked in colour b other than row 0 which will be worked in colour a - sometimes more than one stitch will be worked into the same front loop such
